Mar 13, 2004

Eugenics

The March 8th issue of the New Yorker has an excellent article (by Claudia Roth Pierpont) on Franz Boas (1858-1942), the “father” of American cultural anthropology. His influence can be seen by a short list of some of his most famous students: Ruth Benedict, Melville Herskovits, Zora Neale Hurston, Alfred L. Kroeber, Margaret Mead, Ashley Montag...

Mar 11, 2004

Taishang

Taishang is a composite word combining “Taiwan” and “Shanghai” “Shangye” (meaning business) [thanks to Jonathan for correcting my mistake!] – it refers to Taiwanese businessmen who live and work semi-permanently in Mainland China. Most live either in Shaghai, or in Fujian province, across the Taiwan Strait. Many have “second wives” i...
